Key Match Events: The Milwaukee Brewers broke a 4-4 tie in the 10th inning on a double play as designated runner Eric Haase scored, and Devin Williams made it stand up for a 5-4 win over the Cincinnati Reds.
Pinch hitter Brice Turang had a bunt single that moved Haase to third against Alexis Diaz.
Devin Williams entered the game for the bottom of the 10th and earned his seventh save in eight tries.
Devin Williams has retired 24 straight Reds batters dating back to 2022.
Willie Adames homered off Nick Martinez leading off the second inning for the Brewers.
William Contreras hit his 19th home run in the fourth inning.
Santiago Espinal hit his ninth home run of the season for the Reds in the bottom of the second inning.
Jonathan India hit his 13th home run in the fifth inning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jackson Chourio twisted his right ankle trying to beat out a ball in the shortstop hole in the fifth inning but stayed in the game.
Brewers' Wade Miley began throwing and is seeing Dr. Timothy Kremchek in Cincinnati to assess his progress.
Reds' Hunter Greene has reduced pain from the contusion on his right elbow and began throwing.
Others: Second game of the day/night doubleheader: Rhett Lowder, the seventh pick in last year's draft, will make his Major League debut. DL Hall (0-1, 6.43) will pitch for the Brewers.
